titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Richard Winger "Communist Party Candidates for Public Office, 1921 to 1986" Manuscript TAM.341
titlestmt.author: Processed by Peter Meyer Filardo

editionstmt.p: This version was derived from winger.doc

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-20 16:30:17 -0400.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Richard Winger "Communist Party Candidates for Public Office, 1921 to 1986" Manuscript
did.abstract: This typescript, approximately 250 leaves, was compiled in 1988 by Richard Winger of San Francisco, Calif., from official election returns and the Communist Party press. It lists, by year, national, state, and local candidates for public office who publicly represented themselves as communists, whether or not they were so identified on the election ballot.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated by Deborah Gerson in 2005 with the Simon W. and Sophie Gerson Papers, TAM 330. The accession number associated with this collection is 2005.003.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The pages are organized chronologically by year, and within each year, alphabetically by state.
The files are grouped into one series:

list.head: Missing Title
list.item: I, Communist Party Candidates for Public Office, 1921 to 1986

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: This typescript, approximately 250 leaves, was compiled in 1988 by Richard Winger of San Francisco, Calif., from official election returns and the Communist Party press.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material at the Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
relatedmaterial.p: Simon W. and Sophie Gerson Papers (TAM 330)
Richard Winger Progressive and Radical Political Parties Collection (TAM 560)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This typescript lists, by year, national, state, and local candidates for public office in partisan and non-partisan elections who publicly represented themselves as communists, whether or not they were so identified on the election ballot. The listings including the following information: office sought, candidate's name, votes received, percentage of votes received.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1988, are expected to enter the public domain in 2108.
